description: From Middle English suant (“following”), from Anglo-Norman suant, from Old French suiant, sivant, present participle of sivre (“to follow”), from Latin sequor.

adjectives.description: suant (comparative more suant, superlative most suant)

entries.meaning: (obsolete or dialectal, rare) Smooth, or proceeding smoothly.

adverbs.description: suant (comparative more suant, superlative most suant)

entries.meaning: (obsolete or dialectal, rare) Smoothly; without difficulty.
